'Vinton Gray "Vint" Cerf' (; born June 23, 1943) is an
American computer scientist, who is recognized as one of (see [http://www.gcn.com/print/25_2/38005-
1.html?topic=interview Interview with Vinton Cerf], from a January 2006 article
in [[Government Computer News]]), Cerf is willing to call himself one of the
Internet's fathers, citing Bob Kahn and Leonard Kleinrock in particular as being
others with whom he should share that title. "the fathers of the
Internet", sharing this title with American computer scientist Bob
Kahn. His contributions have been acknowledged and lauded,
repeatedly, with honorary degrees and awards that include the National Medal of
Technology, the Turing Award, [http://www.n-
ytimes.com/2005/02/16/technology/16internet.html?oref=login Cerf wins Turing
Award] Feb 16, 2005 the Presidential Medal of Freedom, [http://georgewbush-
whitehouse.archives.gov/news/releases/2005/11/20051109-10.html 2005 Presidential
Medal of Freedom recipients] from the White House website and membership
in the National Academy of Engineering.

In the early days, Cerf was a program manager for the United States Department
of Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) funding various groups to
develop TCP/IP technology. When the Internet began to transition to a commercial
opportunity during the late 1980s, Cerf moved to MCI where he was instrumental
in the development of the first commercial email system (MCI Mail) connected to
the Internet.

Cerf was instrumental in the funding and formation of ICANN from the start. He
waited in the wings for a year before he stepped forward to join the ICANN
Board, eventually becoming chairman.

Cerf was elected as the president of the Association for Computing Machinery in
May 2012. [http://www.acm.org/press-room/news-releases/2012/acm-officers-
2012 ACM Elects Vint Cerf as President] from the ACM website

Cerf went to Van Nuys High School along with Jon Postel and Steve Crocker; he
wrote the former's obituary. Both were also instrumental in the creation of the
Internet as we know it.
